note.p: Birth: Parish of St George of Tombland, Norwich, Norfolk, England (06 April 1770)
Death: 4 Upper Portland Place, London (03 July 1859)
Education: Pembroke Hall, Cambridge; BA (1792), MA (1794), BD (1801), DD (1806)

Career: Vicar of Buckden, Huntingdonshire, and of Holbeach, Lincoln (received from Bishop Pretyman); Preacher at Lincoln's Inn (1824-1833); Bishop of Chester (1831); Bishop of Durham (1836); resigned on pension of Â£4500 (1856); was a Greek scholar
